definition: Zhu Kezhen (1890-1974), Chinese metereologist and geologist
variant of 篤|笃[du3]
surname Zhu/abbr. for 天竺[Tian1 zhu2] India (esp. in Tang or Buddhist context)/Buddhism (archaic)
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
evergreen shrub

sentences.english: Prof, Zhu Kezhcn is both a pioneer and a founder of modern geography in China.
sentences.chinese: 竺可桢教授是中国近代科学地理学的先驱与奠基人。

sentences.english: After he got the Doctor's Dearee of Meteorology, he returned to China.
sentences.chinese: 获得气象学博士学位后，竺可桢回国。

sentences.english: In 1936 he became President of Zhejiang University.
sentences.chinese: 1936年，竺可桢出任浙江大学校长。

definition: Su Buqing (1902-2003), Chinese mathematician
Li Siguang (1889-1971), Mongol-born, Japanese trained geologist, prominent in early PRC oil exploration
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Qian Sanqiang
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Tsung-Dao Lee (1926-), Chinese American physicist, Columbia University, 1957 Nobel laureate
Hua Luogeng (1910-1985), Chinese number theorist
Zhao Zhongyao (1902-1998), Chinese pioneer nuclear physicist
Qian Xuesen (1911-2009), Chinese scientist and aeronautical engineer
Mao Yisheng (1896-1989), Chinese structural engineer and social activist
Tao Xingzhi (1891-1946), Chinese educator and reformer
John Leighton Stuart (1876-1962), second-generation American missionary in China, first president of Yenching University and later United States ambassador to China
Shiing-Shen Chern (1911-2004), Chinese-American mathematician
Feng Youlan (1895-1990), distinguished Chinese philosopher
Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
